posts.name: 4505 Burger and BBQ
posts.note: 4505 Burger and BBQ is a BBQ spot run by a butcher, with smoked meats, sides, and burgers, to stay on the patio or to-go. If you have a small group, you need to order the Presidential platter which contains a little bit of everything on their menu.

posts.name: Benu
posts.note: Benu is a minimalist SoMa spot featuring innovative, ultra-pricey American cuisine, and renowned tasting menu. Order dumplings, especially the Foie gras soup dumpling (Xiao long bao).

posts.name: Cafe La Taza
posts.note: Cafe La Taza is a counter-service cafe serves a wide range of fare from breakfast through early dinner. NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: Cockscomb
posts.note: Cockscomb is an upscale California fare served in a buzzy, 2-floor space with an open kitchen and farm-animal decor. Cockscomb's head chef is Chris Cosentino who is famous for his offal dishes.

posts.name: Dandelion Chocolate
posts.note: Dandelion Chocolate is a small-batch chocolatier offering handmade candy bars and brownies, cocoa beans, and educational classes. They serve hot chocolates, espresso drinks, frozen drinks, and a full line of pastries made in-house by our Executive Pastry Chef, Lisa Vega. To catch a view of their production process, grab a seat along the chalkboard corridor with a hot chocolate and watch their chocolate makers make cocoa beans into chocolate bars.

posts.name: Dynamo Donuts
posts.note: Dynamo Donuts's owner, Sara Spearin's menu, changes all the time, with inspired flavors like vanilla-orange zest and chocolate star anise sprinkled with cocoa nibs. The bacon-maple doughnut, with smoky saut√©ed apples, is now available every day. It's a hip, compact stop for donuts and coffee.

posts.name: El Tonayense
posts.note: El Tonayense has been in the Mission District for over 20 years. They wanted to bring authentic Mexican foods to the United States. You need to order the chicken and tripe tacos.

posts.name: Ferry Building Marketplace
posts.note: The Ferry Building Marketplace has vendors that sell produce, cheese, coffee, candy, cured meats, and prepared food in this soaring, restored 1898 space. If you like charcuterie, you need to get to Boccalone Salumeria.

posts.name: Grand Harbor
posts.note: Grand Harbor is a bayside Chinese restaurant offering dim sum and close-up views of airliners flying into and out of SFO. You should order the BBQ Pork buns which are a bit on the sweat side or any of their dim sum.

posts.name: La Taqueria
posts.note: La Taqueria is a no-frills taqueria serves Mexican eats, including famed traditional-style, rice-free burritos. If you can only order one item on the menu make sure it's the Carne Asada burrito.

posts.name: Mission Chinese Food
posts.note: Mission Chinese Food is a trendy place where crowds line up for the imaginative Chinese eats at this casual, nationally known destination. Order the Tingling lamb which is lamb and soup or the Mapo Tofu with beef or Kung Pao Pastrami.

posts.name: Muguboka
posts.note: Muguboka is a homey, no-frills spot known for large portions of banchan (Korean side dishes) and other hearty fare. According to Danny Bowen, you should order number four and 64.

posts.name: Panchita's #2 Restaurant
posts.note: Panchita's #2 Restaurant serves pupusas in a variety of flavors offered along with other Latin American staples in a humble space. Adan Savage said to order their fantastic pupusas and said their beans are the best and the 'Mixed Papusa' is KING.

posts.name: Radio Africa and Kitchen
posts.note: Radio Africa and Kitchen has market-fresh Ethiopian and American dishes which they serve with beer and wine in cheerful surrounds.

posts.name: Shizen Vegan Sushi Bar and Izakaya
posts.note: Shizen Vegan Sushi Bar and Izakaya serves vegan fare, from faux-sushi, and ramen to meatless small plates, in an inventive, wood-decked space. Adam Savage recommends the vegan sushi.

posts.name: Swan Oyster Depot
posts.note: Swan Oyster Depot is a no-frills counter nook in a fish market is a bustling landmark for raw-bar fare & casual seafood.

posts.name: Taquer√≠a El Farolito
posts.note: Taquer√≠a El Farolito is a busy, no-frills Mexican eatery and late-night haunt serving comfort food like tacos and burritos. NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: Turtle Tower Restaurant
posts.note: Turtle Tower Restaurant is simply decorated, cash-only spot serving Vietnamese noodles, soups, and other classic fare. Order the chicken, giblets, gizzards, etc. pho. NOTE: They have multiple locations.
